description: Talking about past mistakes, possibilities, and deductions.

resources.reading_highlight:
The 2022 World Cup Final

It was one of the greatest games in history. Argentina must have felt confident leading 2-0. France could have given up, but Mbappé scored twice. Many fans thought Argentina might have lost their chance. In the end, Messi must have been relieved to finally lift the trophy. The French defenders shouldn't have let Di Maria score that first goal!

(Click the past modals to highlight them)
resources.structure:
MODAL VERB + HAVE + PAST PARTICIPLE


She must have forgotten her keys.
resources.probability_scale:
• 90-100% (Certainty)
    Must have / Can't have
  • 50% (Possibility)
    Could have / May have / Might have
resources.alternatives:
• Supposed to have (Plan failed)
    'The train was supposed to have arrived.'

  • Needed to have (Necessary)
    'You needed to have submitted the form.'

practice_gaps.q: She walked past me! She ___ (see) me.

resources.speaking:
• Tell me about a time you made a mistake. What should you have done differently?
  • Think of a time you were late. What might have happened if you had arrived on time?
resources.pronunciation:
The Weak 'Have' (/əv/)

When we speak quickly, 'have' is NOT stressed.

Must have ➝ Must'av
Should have ➝ Should'av
